abstract: Citigroup’s sale of its German banking operations to Crédit Mutuel of France for 4.9 billion euros ($7.7 billion) in cash sets the stage for what could be a wave of mergers in German banking.
snippet: Citigroup’s sale of its German banking operations to Crédit Mutuel of France for 4.9 billion euros ($7.7 billion) in cash sets the stage for what could be a wave of mergers in German banking.
lead_paragraph: FRANKFURT  Citigroup, reeling from subprime losses and eager to shed assets, said Friday that it would sell its German banking operations to Crédit Mutuel of France for 4.9 billion euros ($7.7 billion) in cash, setting the stage for what could be a wave of mergers in German banking.

headline.main: Citigroup to Sell Unit in Germany
headline.print_headline: Citigroup To Sell Unit In Germany
